sentence.Network_en: The price of petrol is coming down by four pence a gallon.
sentence.Network_cn: 汽油的价格每加仑降了4便士。

sentence.Network_en: Any more raffle tickets? Twenty-five pence each or five for a pound.
sentence.Network_cn: 还有要买奖券的吗？每张25便士，1英镑5张。

sentence.Network_en: The telephone booths accept 10 and 20 pence coins.
sentence.Network_cn: 电话亭可使用10便士和20便士的硬币。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 便士（pence）在中世纪是小额银币，它的名字和第纳尔、德涅尔一样为人熟知。评论| 便士是英镑的一分，一英镑=100便士。
there you go , 20 pence change .给，这是20便士的找头。

sentences.en: As from Sunday,May 1st,all fares on the corporation’s transport services will be increased by ten pence in the pound.
sentences.cn: 从5月1日即星期日起,本公司运输费将每磅提高10便士。

sentences.en: At yesterday’s auction an old coin sold for many times more than its face value of 20 pence.
sentences.cn: 昨天的拍卖会上，一枚20便士的古币以高出面值多倍的价格售出。
